Announcer.FE_MA_PickupBattery_03: <Text.Cyan>Batteries</> power your defences. Put them inside your <Text.Orange>Power Nodes</>.
Announcer.TutorialObjectiveAimShoot: <Text.Orange>Aim</> your weapon and shoot those targets!
Announcer.FE_MA_DepletedPowernode_04: <Text.Orange>Power Node</> has no energy. Look for a <Text.Cyan>Battery!</>
Announcer.FE_MA_DepletedPowernode_05: <Text.Orange>Power Node</> is outta’ juice! Power it up, pronto!
Announcer.FE_MA_DepletedPowernode_02: <Text.Orange>Power Node</> needs a <Text.Cyan>Battery</>. Find one A-SAP!
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Buildcredits_E: <Text.Orange>Traps</> don’t use any power but they can be offensive towards enemies.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Buildcredits_F: <Text.Orange>Walls</> can be useful for holding off the enemies advances, but not for long.
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnUfo_02: <Text.Red>Aliens</>! And I don’t think they come in peace!
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnArmyMen_01: <Text.Red>Army Men</> will not hesitate to shoot you. Watch your <Text.Green>Health</> Solider!
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnJet_02: <Text.Red>Fighter Jets</>? When I was a lad we settled conflicts hand to hand!
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnMeanbot_01: <Text.Red>Meanbots</>... Argh, a headshot won’t do. They’ll just keep coming. Shoot them down until they stop moving!
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnMeanbot_02: <Text.Red>Meanbots</>... they'll just keep coming even without their noggin'. Fill 'em full of BBs until they stop moving!
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnSpinner_01: <Text.Red>Spinners</> are on their way! They’re quick, deadly and bounce all over the place. Don’t let them overwhelm you.
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnArmyMenTank_01: <Text.Red>Tanks</>! I hope for your sake you've built <Text.Orange>Tank Traps</>!
Announcer.FE_MA_PickupBuildcredits_03: <Text.Yellow>Build Credits</> are not to be wasted! Use them to construct your <Text.Orange>Defences</>.
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Hallway_02: <Text.Yellow>Credits</> are your currency and allow you to build <Text.Orange>Defences</>. <Text.Cyan>Batteries</> power your defences and help aid you in battle. Good luck.
Announcer.FE_MA_CoreDestructionImminent_01: A <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</> is about to be destroyed!
Announcer.FE_MA_PlayerJoins_02: A new player... I’ve got my eye on you Soldier!
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Buildcredits_H: After the build mode is complete and you’ve spent all your <Text.Yellow>Credits</> you have to prepare for the oncoming <Text.Orange>Waves</>.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Hypercore_A: Ah yes, this beauty here is the <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</> the brain of our operation. Literally.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Collectable_A: Ah, a <Text.Purple>secret collectible</>. Collecting all these on a level will give you extra unlocks upon completing a level. Other unlocks are given depending on how many <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</>s you are able to protect.
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnZombie_03: ah, the undead want a piece o' the action? show 'em 'ow it be done!
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Hallway_01: Alright Soldier, no dawdling! You’ll need to search the area for <Text.Orange>Weapons</>, <Text.Yellow>Credits</> and <Text.Cyan>Batteries</>.
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnBouncyBall_01: Annoying little pests! A huge swathe of <Text.Red>Bouncy Balls</> doing what they do best: bounce all over the place!
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_ToystoreNightshift_02: arm yerself with flashlights soldiers – it’s dark in 'ere.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Building_B: Arm yourself with the <Text.Orange>Machine Gun</> and <Text.Orange>Stock Attachment</> next to the <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</>.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Jumppad_D: As a matter of fact, you should build that <Text.Orange>Jump Pad</> to see where it leads.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Building_C: Attachments can improve abilities on your weapons such as lowered recoil or improved accuracy.
Announcer.FE_MA_Generic Phrases_BadLuck_01: Bad luck recruit, now get defending that <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</>!
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Attic_04: be careful soldiers, the enemy might 'ave a few surprises fer us around 'ere!
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Health_B: Be sure to keep an eye on your <Text.Green>Health</> and <Text.Cyan>Shield</>.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Teammate_A: Because you are working as a team you should share unused build <Text.Yellow>Credits</> with your team mates.
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Shed_02: bit dark an' dingy in 'ere - watch out fer the spiders, soldier.
Announcer.FE_MA_BuildDefenses_02: Build some <Text.Orange>Fortifications</>! You need some line of defence!
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_KidsBedroom_01: Command told me Andy won’t be home for another hour. We must destroy the enemy before he returns!
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnJet_01: Cowards! They're sending in <Text.Red>Fighter Jets</>! Watch out for their missiles!
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnChungus_02: disgustin' creatures! keep their slime away from the core!
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Apartment_02: Do not think about eating the rest of that Pizza. It is mine!
Announcer.FE_MA_BuildDefenses_01: Do you have a death wish Soldier? How are you going to survive without building <Text.Orange>Defences</>?
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnDemolisher_01: Do you want to be disintegrated? Do not let the <Text.Red>Demolishers</> laser beam hit you!
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Garage_02: Does... anyone have a driving licence?
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Jumppad_C: Don’t be afraid to climb, jump and explore – you never know what <Text.Purple>secrets</> you will find.
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnPony_02: don’t be fooled by their cuteness, they be evil creatures!
Announcer.FE_MA_BuildDefenses_04: Don’t forget to build <Text.Orange>Walls</>, <Text.Orange>Traps</> and construct <Text.Orange>Turrets</>!
Announcer.FE_MA_PowernodeLow_05: Don’t forget to keep your <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</> powered! <Text.Orange>Power Node</> is nearly out!
Announcer.FE_MA_BuildmodeEndsWave_12: Don’t forget to search the area, any <Text.Yellow>Resources</> you find will help you defend the <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</>s.
Announcer.FE_MA_Generic Phrases_DontGiveUp_01: don’t give to the sky, there be still time to succeed!
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnBouncyBall_03: don’t underestimate them colourful balls – they'll take ye down in no time.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Powernode_A: enemies defeated, that there wasn’t so 'ard after all.
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnChopper_02: Enemy <Text.Red>Helicopters</> are trying to control the skies, I hope for your sake you have <Text.Orange>Anti-Air</> defences!
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnSoldier_02: Enemy <Text.Red>Soldiers</> on the field! Highly trained, but we trained you better, squad!
Announcer.FE_MA_EnemyDestroyedBuildables_06: Enemy has taken out some of your <Text.Orange>Defences</>, keep an eye on the <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</>.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Building_A: Fetch some more <Text.Yellow>Build Credits</> and build yourself a <Text.Orange>turret</>.
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnTrex_02: Finally, a real threat! The <Text.Red>T-Rex</> has a weak spot, find it!
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_ToyPalace_05: Find <Text.Cyan>Batteries</> and charge up your <Text.Orange>Power Nodes</>.
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Garden_01: First things first. The <Text.Red>Dinosaur</>... it's not friendly.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Jump_A: Firstly let’s start with the very basics: <Text.Orange>Jump</> – <Text.Orange>Double Jump</> and <Text.Orange>Vault</>.
Announcer.TutorialObjectiveNextArea: Follow the <Text.Yellow>Credits</> to the next area
Announcer.FE_MA_EnemyDestroyedBuildables_04: fortify yer lines, soldier! the enemy be overpowerin' 'em!
Announcer.FE_MA_PlayerJoins_01: Fresh meat! Oh. I mean... Plastic!
Announcer.FE_MA_Killed_Tank_01: From now on, I’m gonna call you the tank busta!
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnCargoPlane_01: Get to cover! We have a <Text.Red>Cargo Plane</> on the way and its packed full of <Text.Red>Paratroopers</>!
Announcer.FE_MA_BuildmodeEndsWave_10: Get your defences built A-SAP, the enemy are on their way!
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Teammate_B: Give a few <Text.Yellow>Credits</> to your team mate.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Buildcredits_D: Go ahead and build some simple defences around the core with the <Text.Yellow>build credits</> you picked up earlier.
Announcer.FE_MA_PickupBattery_02: Good job. You’ve found a <Text.Cyan>Battery</>. Place it inside your <Text.Orange>Power Node</>, located near the <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</>.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Finale_B: jolly luck on the battlefield, soldier!
Announcer.FE_MA_BuildmodeEndsWave_09: Good luck, we’re counting on your keeping those <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</>s alive.
Announcer.FE_MA_PickupBuildcredits_01: Great work soldier! You’ve found <Text.Yellow>Build Credits</>. You can now build <Text.Orange>Defences</>!
Announcer.FE_MA_PlayerJoins_03: jolly! a new addition to the squad.
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Hallway_03: Hit the ground running, soldier. Scour the battlefield for <Text.Orange>Weapons</> and <Text.Yellow>Credits</>. Don’t forget to build <Text.Orange>Defences</> and to keep 'em <Text.Cyan>Powered</>.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Finale_A: I can’t teach you everything about the world of <Text.Yellow>HYPERCHARGE</> as there is much more to explore and find.
Announcer.FE_MA_Boss_CargoPlane_02: Ya don't like iron birds eh?
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Attic_03: I have a bad feeling about this place....
Announcer.FE_MA_Defeat_04: I know ye can do better. So dig in an' give it all ye got, laddie!
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Arcade_02: I miss the 80’s... oh I feel so old, my ball-joints are creakin'!
Announcer.FE_MA_BuildmodeEndsWave_08: I trust you’ll keep those <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</>s alive, you got this!
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Garage_01: If our enemy learns how to drive... we’re doomed!
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Lavalevel_02: If you fall into the lava... there’s no repairing you Soldier.
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Kitchen_02: if ye lose this here battle i’ll make ye eat the broccoli, soldier!
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnJet_03: Incoming <Text.Red>Fighter Jets</>, let’s hope you have some <Text.Orange>Anti-Air</> defences!
Announcer.FE_MA_BuildmodeEndsWave_04: it doesn’t look like a battlefield now, but that there'll change right quick. Get ready.
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Bathroom_01: It doesn’t matter who blocked the toilet, just protect the <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</>s!
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnDemolisher_04: it 'as 'eavy duty armor! it must 'ave a weak point!
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_HallwayHard_01: It might look like a Hallway... because it is just... a hallway.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Intro_B: It won’t take long for you to become a true soldier.
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Shed_01: it’s claustrophobic in 'ere – try not to let it get to ye.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Defeat_C: I’m sure you’ll get them next time.
Announcer.FE_MA_PowernodeLow_03: Keep an eye on your <Text.Cyan>Power</>! <Text.Orange>Power Node</> is running on empty!
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnTrex_01: Keep your composure Soldier! It’s only a little <Text.Red>T-Rex</>!
Announcer.FE_MA_BuildmodeEndsWave_11: keep yer wits about ye, the enemy can come from anywhere!
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Lavalevel_01: Lava and Plastic do not mix well.
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Apartment_03: leftovers? don't mind if I do.
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_ToystoreNightshift_01: let’s 'ope the moonlight provides enough visibility.
Announcer.FE_MA_BuildmodeEndsWave_03: let’s 'ope yer lines 'old, the enemies be on their way.
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Arcade_03: let’s keep this here battle contained to the table.
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnCargoPlane_02: looks like they’re droppin' in reinforcements. Stay alert!
Announcer.FE_MA_PickupBuildcredits_02: Lovely jubbly. Go ahead and spend your <Text.Yellow>Build Credits</>. Preferably on your <Text.Orange>Defences</>!
Announcer.FE_MA_PowernodeLow_04: Make sure your <Text.Orange>Power Node</> keeps going, it’s running low!
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnChopper_01: Multiple <Text.Red>Choppers</> inbound. Don’t worry Soldier, your <Text.Orange>Air Defences</> will obliterate them. You have built air defences, right?
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Climb_A: Next, follow the <Text.Yellow>credits</> and climb over those boxes to the next area.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Praise_A: Nice job – I see a lot of potential in you recruit.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Coin_A: Nicely done. Now follow the <Text.Yellow>gold credits</> to the next area.
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Arcade_01: No playing on the arcade machines, you have a job to do!
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Shed_03: not a lot o' space to maneuver. This here one could be tough.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Powernode_B: Now, grab that <Text.Cyan>Battery</> and place it into the <Text.Orange>Power Node</>.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Buildcredits_A: Now, lets learn how to best defend. You should grab those <Text.Yellow>Build Credits</> by the <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</>.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Meanbot_A: Now, use your weapon or melee attack to take out those <Text.Red>Bots</>.
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnDemolisher_02: ohhh lad, that’s a big toy!
Announcer.FE_MA_BuildDefenses_03: Ohhh, so you think you can win without building your <Text.Orange>Defences</>? The loss is on you Soldier!
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_LargeWave_A: Okay, now you’re ready for a bigger challenge. Defend the <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</>!
Announcer.FE_MA_BuildmodeEndsWave_06: prepare fer battle. The enemy draws closer.
Announcer.FE_MA_Defeat_05: Quit your bellyaching and try again soldier!
Announcer.FE_MA_PlayerJoins_05: Reinforcements en-route soldier, hold the line!
Announcer.FE_MA_BuildmodeEndsWave_05: remember to work as a team. Jolly luck squad.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Jumppad_A: Remember, not all battles are won by fighting.
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnMeanbot_03: robotic weaponry. 'ah! they be no match fer ye!
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_ToyPalace_02: So, the enemy are trying to take control of the entire store? They’ll have to get through you first!
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnArmyMen_02: So, they’ve deployed <Text.Red>Greens</> to do their dirty work?
Announcer.FE_MA_CoreDestructionImminent_05: Soldier! Protect the <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</> before it’s too late!
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Garage_03: soldier! quit yer whinin' an' prepare fer battle!
Announcer.FE_MA_Victory_01: Soldier, I’m very proud. It’s an honour to have you defending the <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</>!
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnSpinner_02: Soldier, a little bit of advice: remember to <Text.Orange>Jump</>.
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_ToyPalace_06: some o' ye was purchased 'ere – some o' ye will die 'ere!
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Attic_02: Spiders... I hope there’s no Spiders!
Announcer.FE_MA_Victory_03: squad, you’re in fer a jolly meal tonight. Well done!
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_KidsBedroom_02: Stand up your <Text.Orange>Defences</>, the enemy won’t know what hit 'em!
Announcer.FE_MA_Defeat_03: Suck it up soldier and try again!
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Garden_04: That <Text.Red>T-Rex</> doesn’t want to be fed, he wants to hunt!
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnDemolisher_03: that there scurvy dog looks tough. You’re fixin' to need a big gun fer this here one.
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnUfo_01: That’s strange... My radar is jammed. Look out, something advanced is heading our way!
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnDemolisher_05: The <Text.Red>Demolisher</> has some heavy duty armor! It must have a weak point somewhere!
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Praise_B: The award you will receive for completing a level will be based on how many <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</>s you are able to keep alive and how much damage they receive.
Announcer.FE_MA_Defeat_02: the battle be not o'er until I say so! get aft in there an' win this here round!
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnSoldier_01: the enemy be deployin' their elite operatives! don't get cocky now, soldiers!
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_ToyPalace_01: the enemy be producin' their line o' weaponised toys 'ere. It’s yer job to put a avast to it!
Announcer.FE_MA_EnemyDestroyedBuildables_07: The enemy are pushing closer, <Text.Orange>Defences</> are failing, watch out!
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_ToyPalace_03: the enemy be tryin' to secure reinforcements, soldiers. Put a avast to them!
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnJet_04: the enemy 'ave called in air support! brin' 'em down!
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Kitchen_01: the enemy 'ave made this here kitchen a mess. Let’s mop them to the sky!
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Bathroom_02: The enemy have manoeuvred their way through the pipes and made it into the bathroom. Eliminate them!
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnPony_01: The enemy have sent their cavalry: flying <Text.Red>Ponies</>!
Announcer.FE_MA_EnemyDestroyedBuildables_02: The enemy is destroying your <Text.Orange>Defences</>. Do not forget to rebuild them!
Announcer.FE_MA_EnemyDestroyedBuildables_01: The enemy is too close! Rebuild your <Text.Orange>Defences</>!
Announcer.FE_MA_BuildmodeEndsWave_02: the quiet before the storm, soldier. Keep yer 'ead on tight.
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_HallwayHard_02: the task ahead be not goin' to be easy, I want to see yer best effort!
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnChungus_01: The vile <Text.Red>Chungus</>. Slimy and disgusting. Don’t get close, they explode when they’ve taken enough punishment.
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_KidsBedroom_03: There are no <Text.Cyan>Batteries</> in your <Text.Orange>Power Nodes</>. Look around and find some.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Buildcredits_B: These <Text.Yellow>credits</> will come handy during the build mode. You can press the build button to bring out your build tool.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Jump_B: These actions are all performed with the <Text.Orange>Jump</> button. Collect all the <Text.Yellow>gold credits</> in this area to proceed.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Hypercore_B: These will be what you are defending at all costs.
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Garden_03: This is <Text.Red>Dino</> territory. What could go wrong?
Announcer.FE_MA_PickupBattery_01: This is a <Text.Cyan>Battery</>. Place it in your <Text.Orange>Power Node</> to charge it. It’s that simple.
Announcer.FE_MA_BuildmodeEndsWave_07: This is it. It’s time to save the <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</>s!
Announcer.FE_MA_BuildmodeEndsWave_01: this here may look like a safe place, but ye don’t always know what dangers be lurkin'. Be careful, soldier.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Powernode_C: This will allow the shield of the <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</> to recharge when damaged and will also power turrets that are protecting this <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</>.
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Kitchen_03: time to fry to the sky some justice, soldier!
Announcer.FE_MA_BuildmodeEndsWave_13: Time to put that training to use, don’t let the enemy destroy your <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</>s.
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_ToyPalace_04: To build <Text.Orange>Defences</>, you’ll need to search for <Text.Yellow>Credits</>.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Jumppad_B: Traversing through the environment to find weapons, credits and collectibles is paramount to your success.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Health_A: Trust me, they deserved that. If you do come up against a real threat though...
Announcer.FE_MA_BuildDefenses_06: Use the tools at your disposal! Get some <Text.Orange>Defences</> up, on the double!
Announcer.FE_MA_Generic Phrases_UseWeapon_01: Use your weapon to destroy those targets.
Announcer.FE_MA_Generic Phrases_BatteryNPC_01: Watch out for enemies that may target your <Text.Orange>Power Node</>.
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Garden_02: Watch out for the <Text.Red>Army Men</>, they blend in with the grass!
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnSpinner_03: Watch out for those <Text.Red>Spinners</>, they'll come at you fast! Some <Text.Orange>Glue</> would slow them down.
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnZombie_04: watch out fer them abominations. Destroyin' their limbs will slow 'em down.
Announcer.FE_MA_EnemyDestroyedBuildables_05: Watch out, the enemy are destroying your <Text.Orange>Defences</>!
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_ToyPalace_07: we be in the 'eart o' enemy territory 'ere, soldiers. Put a avast to their advances!
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Intro_A: Welcome recruit, I’m Max Ammo and I’m here to prepare and guide you through basic training.
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Apartment_01: What a messy apartment. When we win the battle, clean up this place!
Announcer.FE_MA_CoreAttacked_05: What are you doing?! The <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</> is taking damage!
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnZombie_02: What kind o' foul beast would create somethin' like this here?
Announcer.FE_MA_CoreAttacked_04: What's going on?! The <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</> is taking damage!
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_HallwayHard_03: Where’s the torches when you need ’em?
Announcer.FE_MA_SpawnZombie_01: Who created these monstrosities... clearly a failed experiment.
Announcer.FE_MA_MapIntro_Attic_01: Who knows what evil toys be 'idin' in 'ere!
Announcer.FE_MA_Killed_Jet_03: Who needs an anti-air turret when we 'ave you?!
Announcer.FE_MA_Generic Phrases_NotSupposed_01: You are not supposed to be here.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Buildcredits_G: You can also destroy <Text.Orange>Buildables</> for a partial refund of their costs.
Announcer.FE_MA_Generic Phrases_AimKey_01: You can hold the Aim button to help improve your accuracy when shooting.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Health_C: You can see that in the bottom right of your ‘heads up display’.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Hypercore_C: You can see their <Text.Green>Health</>, <Text.Cyan>Shield</> and <Text.Yellow>Battery Power</> in the top left of your heads up display.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_SmallWave_B: You can see your current <Text.Orange>Wave</> and the <Text.Yellow>Progression</> in the top left of your ‘Heads Up Display’.
Announcer.FE_MA_BuildDefenses_07: You can’t always win with weapons alone. Build some <Text.Orange>defences</>!
Announcer.FE_MA_BuildDefenses_08: You should build some defences around the <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</>s.
Announcer.FE_MA_BuildDefenses_05: You won’t survive without building some <Text.Orange>Defences</>!
Announcer.FE_MA_Generic Phrases_BatteryEmpty_01: Your <Text.Cyan>Battery</> has ran out, find another one to keep your <Text.Yellow>HYPERCORE</> and <Text.Orange>Turrets</> powered.
Announcer.FE_MA_EnemyDestroyedBuildables_03: Your <Text.Orange>Defences</> are being destroyed! Be vigilant!
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Buildcredits_C: Your <Text.Yellow>Credit</> count can be seen in the bottom right of the HUD.
Announcer.FE_MA_Tutorial_Meanbot_B: Your ammo is shown in the bottom right of the ‘Heads up Display’.
Announcer.FE_MA_EnemyDestroyedBuildables_09: yer defences be falling, I 'ope ye 'ave enough credits to rebuild!
Announcer.FE_MA_Boss_CargoPlane_01: You’re a great asset to the war effort soldier!
Announcer.FE_MA_Victory_02: you’ve just saved all o' toy-kind.

ST_Game.DescBattery: 1.5 volts of alkaline power. These energy cells are vital to the operation of Power Nodes and HYPRECOREs. They can be thrown a great distance, which is an efficient way to insert them into a Power Node quickly.
ST_Game.TextTipInfoComingSoon: <Text.Grey>The map is not yet ready, check back here when the game is updated to play these new maps!</>
ST_Game.UnlockTextNotInDemo: <Text.Red>This Unlock is not available in the Demo version!</>
ST_Game.UnlockTextMapNotInDemo: <Text.Red>{Map} is not available in the Demo version!</>
ST_Game.DescBatteryHC: A rare, powerful battery that was discontinued after only one year thanks to the propensity for them to occasionally explode. It <Text.Orange>probably</> won't explode in your hands, <Text.Orange>probably</>. The amount of power this battery delivers is vast, as is its carbon footprint.
ST_Game.MapHallwaySimpleDescPvP: a simple 'allway with not a lot o' cover, but the shelves make fer a jolly stronghold. Try to stay in cover!
ST_Game.TipDifficultyHard: A tough experience that there requires true 'ypercharge 'eros to complete. Much more suited fer multiple players who can work as a team, share resources an' form a build-strategy fer each level. It be called expert fer a reason.
ST_Game.DescJumpPad: A useful piece of equipment that propels personnel to new heights. Build Jump Pads on the battlefield to reach elevated positions quickly.
ST_Game.EndOfRoundDefaultLoseReason: all o' yer cores 'ave been lost
ST_Game.MapKidsBedroomDescPL: Anyone left on the ground will suffer a terrible fate. 'idin' be futile in this here very open bedroom.
ST_Game.TurretRocketPlusDesc: Bigger dual-launcher rocket turret. Useful for taking out large groups enemies.
ST_Game.TurretRocketPlusPlusDesc: Biggest triple-launcher rocket turret. Useful for taking out large groups and powerful enemies.
ST_Game.DescCollectible: Collect all of these on the battlefield to unlock additional equipment, body parts, and names.
ST_Game.UnlockTextHolidayHalloween: Complete any level during the <Text.Purple>Halloween</> season!
ST_Game.UnlockTextHolidayXmas: Complete any level during the <Text.Purple>Xmas</> season!
ST_Game.MapToyPalaceDesc: Defend the aisle from the invading toys. Prepare yourselves for a battle on the shelves. And don't forget to keep your eyes on the skies!
ST_Game.MapHallwayHardDescPL: Don’t get cornered in this hallway, there are few places to hide around here... just keep running!
ST_Game.MapGarageDescPL: Don’t let the smell of diesel fuel mask the stench of the infected.
ST_Game.UnlockTextSpecialCompleteSubAwards: Earn {Award} or above on all levels!
ST_Game.UnlockTextAwardAnyMap: Earn {Award} or above, to unlock on that level!
ST_Game.CheatDesc2: Enables BP Mode - Everything is blue. This seems cool at first, but is also impossible to play.
ST_Game.CheatDesc1: Enables DK Mode - Classic large head cheat. Every game is legally required to have this, only some choose to allow it to be enabled by the player.
ST_Game.CheatDesc7: Enables Lame Aim Down Sights mode. We’re not sure how the toys bend this way... also I’m pretty sure the scopes are made of solid plastic?
ST_Game.CheatDesc3:
Enables Low Gravity - Moon gravity time! Watch ragdolls float away with this revolutionary next-gen cheat code.

<Text.Grey>This cheat only works in Singleplayer/Splitscreen!</>
ST_Game.DescJetPack: Equipment that enables personnel to augment their jump. Propulsion lasts just a few seconds before the unit must recharge.
ST_Game.UnlockTextSpecialAllCollectibles: Find all <Text.Purple>Hidden Collectibles</> on all levels!
ST_Game.DescStickerBook: Find and unlock all of the name packs to fill this sticker book! Gotta collect em' all! (Official sticker booklet sold separately)
ST_Game.MapBathroomDesc: Flush away your fears. The enemy are coming for our plumbing, stop them immediately! Don’t forget to check the bath.
ST_Game.TurretSpotLightPlusDesc: Greatly increases visibility in darker environments and increases all damage dealt to enemies in its light beam.
ST_Game.DescPlayer: HYPERCHARGE brand action figure with fully customisable, swappable parts. Defender of the HYPERCORE and destroyer of all who threaten it.
ST_Game.DescWeaponsAttachments: HYPERCHARGE brand equipment is stored in the boxes we came in. Technically it is still owned by the company so if you want to use it you’ll need to purchase it with credits found on the battlefield.
ST_Game.DescTeleporter: HYPERCHARGE brand equipment that will transmit personnel across the Hypernetwork and rematerialise them at a paired destination unit. Our psychologists recommend that you do not think about the fact that the dematerialisation process will kill you then reconstruct you someplace else. Place a battery in the transmitter unit to operate.
ST_Game.CheatDesc9: He is the Sergeant for a reason. Bring in Max Ammo himself to help in the fight again the enemy toys. He's powerful and gets the job done. You can also bring him in for some multilplayer combat. If you dare.
ST_Game.TurretSpotLightDesc: Helps visibility in darker environments and increases all damage dealt to enemies in its light beam.
ST_Game.StatJumpPadHint: Hint: Batteries can be thrown onto Jump Pads
ST_Game.CheatDesc6: Hold your weapon like we did in the good old days and play like a Pro. Combine with grenade-jumping for maximum nostalgia.
ST_Game.MapToyPalaceDescPL: Hop from shelf to shelf and avoid the plagued toys.
ST_Game.MapShedDescPL: Hope that you spawn on the top and with enough ammo to survive. It won’t take long until you’re infected.
ST_Game.TrapFirePlusDesc: Hottest defensive flame trap on the market. Defend your base using fires from Hell.
ST_Game.DescCharger: Hyper™ brand Hypercharger™ will Hypercharge™ your Hyperbatteries™. Maybe regular batteries too but we haven’t tested it.
ST_Game.MapKitchenDescPvP: If you can’t stand the heat, too bad.
ST_Game.MapActionAtticDescPvP: Jump, climb, and shoot on this cluttered and dusty battlefield.
ST_Game.TurretAntiAirDesc: Keeps your skies clear. A great way to fight back against speedy aircraft.
ST_Game.TurretAntiAirPlusDesc: Keeps your skies clear. The best way to fight against large aircraft or unidentified flying objects.
ST_Game.TurretTurbineDesc: Launches enemies in the direction it is facing. It’s unclear how this is in any way advantageous.
ST_Game.TurretTurbinePlusDesc: Launches multiple enemies in the direction it is facing. A surprisingly good defense if used appropriately.
ST_Game.GameMessagePlagueFlagsEnabled: NEW CAPTURE ZONES ARE NOW ACTIVE!
ST_Game.MapHallwaySimpleDescPL: Not many places to run in this Hallway. Those who climb the highest will survive the longest.
ST_Game.MapBathroomDescPL: Nowhere to hide, nowhere to run. Can you quickly climb higher than the infected?
ST_Game.TipDifficultyEasy: Offers a fun and exciting experience, while also trying to make it more accessible to new Players. This difficulty offers more time when decision making, and will favour spawning weaker versions of enemies.
ST_Game.MapKidsBedroomDescPvP: Only scant cover exists in this bedroom, use the Jump Pad’s to your advantage and keep off the ground or you’ll be a sitting duck!
ST_Game.TrapMinePlusDesc: Packed with lots of explosives and rigged to explode when enemies are nearby. Only good for one use!
ST_Game.MapGarageDesc: Park your defenses in this wide-open combat zone. Climbing may be tricky in this cluttered garage.
ST_Game.TurretCannonDesc: Perfect for defending any castle. Fires a stone boulder that can hit multiple enemies in its path.
ST_Game.DescPowerNode: Power Nodes connect directly to a HYPERCORE to recharge its shield. Batteries not included.
ST_Game.TrapFireDesc: Powerful defensive flame trap to cook your enemies in seconds!
ST_Game.TrapMineDesc: Rigged to explode when enemies are nearby. Only good for one use!
ST_Game.MapTutorialDesc: Sergeant Max Ammo talks you through the basics of the mechanics of HYPERCHARGE.
ST_Game.TrapVinesDesc: Simple spikey vine trap that has a chance to inflict lasting poison damage to enemies.
ST_Game.TurretMachineGunCannonDesc: Slow and powerful Machine Gun Turret. Useful for small numbers of strong enemies.
ST_Game.TurretMachineGunDesc: Small and inaccurate Machine Gun Turret. Useful for defending cores against multiple small and weak enemies.
ST_Game.TurretRocketDesc: Small single-launcher rocket turret. Useful for taking out multiple small enemies.
ST_Game.StatGlue: Some enemies may get completely stuck.
ST_Game.MapActionAtticDesc: Spelunk through the junk and mind the dust. Just keep those HYPERCORES alive!
ST_Game.TrapSpikesDesc: Spikes enemies as they walk over the pressure plate. Powerful and quickly repeating damage.
ST_Game.TrapSpikesPlusDesc: Stabs enemies as they walk over the sensitive pressure plate. Powerful and quickly repeating damage.
ST_Game.DescSlotMachine: Step right up and try your luck! 30 credits to play. Win amazing prizes
ST_Game.TrapVinesPlusDesc: Strong poison vine trap that will inflict lasting poison damage to enemies.
ST_Game.TrapWallPlusDesc: Sturdier defensive blocker that will divert enemy paths or force them to break it down.
ST_Game.TrapWallDesc: Sturdy defensive blocker that will divert enemy paths or force them to break it down.
ST_Game.DescCore: The HYPERCORE is the most important piece of equipment on the battlefield and must be defended at all costs. If the HYPERCOREs are destroyed, the connection toys have with humans will be severed and toys will lose their purpose. At least that's what the instruction manual claims.
ST_Game.MapKitchenDescPL: The cooking isn’t the only biohazard!
ST_Game.MapKidsBedroomDesc: The enemy is planning to invade our stronghold. Push them back! Watch out for the vents and shelves.
ST_Game.TipAwards: The enemy wants to meddle with our HYPERCOREs. If you prove your mettle and stop them you will be awarded with a medal made from valuable metal.
ST_Game.MapTutorialDescPvP: The gloves are off this time. Fight against other players in the place that your journey began.
ST_Game.MapGardenDescPvP: The grass offers minimal cover - perfect for an aspiring sniper, ready to creep from bush to bush as they hunt the most dangerous prey in this immense garden.
ST_Game.MapShedDesc: The shed is surrounded, watch the roof for enemies dropping in from above and cover the shelves in as many turrets as you can. This is going to be a close one.
ST_Game.MapHallwayHardDesc: The war over this hallway will be fought from two directions. Grab a flashlight and keep your eyes peeled, this could be tough.
ST_Game.CheatDesc8: The year is 1995. You have just opened your new <CHILDHOOD CONSOLE NAME>! It only came with one game called HYPERCHARGE: Unboxed. You will play this game for many hours and somehow never get bored.
ST_Game.MapGardenDesc: There are reports of dinos in the area. Take care in the tall grass and use the teleporters to cover more ground!
ST_Game.DescCredits: Thieving Meanbots stole these coins from the HYPERCHARGE vault and scattered them around the battlefield. Collect them to purchase new equipment. Think of it like an allowance that you get to spend on guns.
ST_Game.MapKitchenDesc: This battlefield comes preheated. Stay out of the oven!
ST_Game.MapHallwayHardDescPvP: This dark hallway offers some varied combat, just got to make sure you can spot the enemy on the move.
ST_Game.TipDifficultyNormal: This difficulty gives a rewarding and challenging experience through the levels, but is usually for players more suited with standard First-Person shooter controls.
ST_Game.MapGarageDescPvP: This garage offers a large combat zone that for both short and long distance combat. Only those skilled enough will be able to lay their hands on the best weapons.
ST_Game.TurretRadarDesc: This high-altitude EMP turret will deal damage to all nearby enemies within its shockwave radius.
ST_Game.TurretLaserDesc: This laser was built to help... err
ST_Game.TrapGunkDesc: This strange smelling substance will slow down some enemies before they reach their target.
ST_Game.TurretLaserPlusDesc: This surgical laser will deliver damage to any enemy that its dual beams are cast toward.
ST_Game.MapShedDescPvP: This tiny gauntlet can get really crazy. Playing with any more than 4 players will become a meat-grinder.
ST_Game.TurretRadarPlusDesc: This very powerful EMP turret will deal massive damage to nearby enemies within its shockwave radius.
ST_Game.TipBatteryCharged: Tip: Batteries can be thrown into Battery slots for faster insertion.
ST_Game.TipBatteryThrowPad: Tip: Batteries can be thrown onto Jump Pads.
ST_Game.TipCoreNoDamage: Tip: Keep a HYPERCORE protected by ensuring no damage is taken to its health.
ST_Game.TipCoreBattery: Tip: Placing batteries in a Power Node will recharge the shield of the HYPERCORE
ST_Game.MapToyPalaceDescPvP: Trust no one, not even your shelf. Lots of hiding places in the Toy Store, but precious few ways to ascend.
ST_Game.TipDifficultyNightmare: Turn back all whom think that this is even fair.
ST_Game.TurretMachineGunPlusDesc: Twice the length, twice the fire-power. Useful for defending cores against multiple enemies.
ST_Game.UnlockTextNightmare: Unlock {Difficulty} 'ardness level by completing all maps with {Award} or above!
ST_Game.CheatDesc4:
Unlocks all the maps so that they are playable without completing the requirements. 

<Text.Grey>This will need to be re-enabled each time you play.</>
ST_Game.CheatDesc5:
Unlocks the Captain Difficulty so yer can regret ever trying it.

<Text.Grey>This will need to be re-enabled each time you play.</>
ST_Game.MapGardenDescPL: Use the huge open space to your advantage, keep ahead of the plague and don’t get cornered. Good luck!
ST_Game.MapActionAtticDescPL: Watch for the ominous glow of infected toys in this dimly lit attic. They could be around any corner...
ST_Game.MapHallwaySimpleDesc: Welcome to Operation Alley. Learn to defend your HYPERCORE against Meanbots.
ST_Game.MapAirhockeyShuffleDesc: Welcome to the Arcade, we’ve got fun and games. Also spinners, lots of spinners.
ST_Game.MapBathroomDescPvP: While it may be the smallest map, you’ll still find yourself fighting for what limited higher ground is available.
ST_Game.CheatDesc10: Yarr matey' this be given yah the language of the Sea. Change your language to that of a true Pirate.
ST_Game.DescAwards: You will be awarded a medal if you save the HYPERCOREs on the battlefield. The more HYPERCOREs you save the more valuable your medal will be.

ST_HUD.TextPromptAttachmentCantPickup: Can't Pick Up {0}, Already Have Attachment
ST_HUD.TextPromptAmmoCantPickup: Can't Pick Up {0}, Ammo Already Full
ST_HUD.TextPromptHealthCantPickup: Can't Pick Up {0}, Health Already Full
ST_HUD.TextPromptFindNode: Look for a Power Node that Requires a <{Colour}>{Pickup}</>{Icon}
ST_HUD.LastManStandingYou: You are the last remaining survivor!

ST_NPC.DescMeatbag: 114 grams of pure malice, however, they only seem to direct this malice toward HYPERCOREs. It is unknown whether Meanbots are sentient or mindless machines. Some personnel have reported Meanbots making yelps upon being shot but this could simply be a result of a short circuit in their wiring.
ST_NPC.DescTank: A small tank, lightly armoured and inexpensively produced but deployed rapidly and in large numbers.
ST_NPC.DescDemolisher: An extremely durable robot that is programmed to destroy HYPERCOREs and soldiers alike. The head is the only vulnerable part and is normally protected by a shield that only raises to fire its powerful laser canon. Exercise extreme caution near this enemy.
ST_NPC.DescBigTank: An intimidating enemy equipped with a powerful 8.3mm smoothbore cannon. The 360 degree rotational ability of the turret makes this tank extremely deadly from all angles.
ST_NPC.DescPony: Charging into battle on a magical cloud, they will love their friends until the very end.  Beware their hunger for AA batteries.
ST_NPC.DescBall: Colorful spheres of rubber that look fun to play with but are actually deadly weapons of war. They impact their target with kinetic energy and always attack in swarms. Precision aiming is required to defeat this easily underestimated enemy.
ST_NPC.DescGliderPlane: Constructed of lightweight polystyrene, Gliderplanes are not a durable aircraft. They fly around the battlefield looking for an opportunity to ram their target head on.
ST_NPC.DescSpaceMen: Dropping from outside of the atmosphere and armed with futuristic laser weapons, these Space Men could be your demise. Don't underestimate these marines, especially not the hand-painted ones.
ST_NPC.DescSoldier: Enemy ground troops built for the purpose of destroying our personnel and equipment. They will shoot on sight and without mercy.
ST_NPC.DescSpinner: High tech killing machines that have blended many soldiers. Spinners utilise a weighted ring system that delivers maximum damage while maintaining manoeuvrability. Avoid contact at all costs.
ST_NPC.DescUFO: Invaders from a distant planetary system. Very little is known about the aliens except that their weapons are especially powerful. Several personnel have been abducted by the aliens never to been seen again, except for one. His personality was severely altered and he has been admitted to a psych ward where he remains to this day.
ST_NPC.DescJet: Jets will fly circles around the battlefield and launch missiles thus making them a major thread to HYPERCOREs. Anti-Air turrets are effective at destroying them.
ST_NPC.DescChopper: Moderately armored rotary aircraft equipped with a machine gun. Capable of delivering heavy damage to equipment and personnel so destroying it quickly is recommended.
ST_NPC.DescZombie: Nearly dead but also nearly alive. Created in a lab, Experiments are unnatural creatures whose purpose is unknown. A being of extremely low intelligence they will attack the nearest thing they deem an enemy, be it a soldier or a HYPERCORE.
ST_NPC.DescArmyMen: Produced in massive numbers, Army Men are designed to swarm the battlefield and are armed with rifles. Their short stature makes them difficult to see in some conditions.
ST_NPC.DescCargoPlane: The Military Cargo Plane is a heavy armoured rotary aircraft designed for troop transport. It is capable of deploying a seemingly endless amount of Army Men onto the battlefield so it is prudent to destroy it quickly and remove the threat.
ST_NPC.DescTrex: The T-Rex is the king of the dinos. This large, bipedal creature has a strong bite and a taste for plastic. Shooting the battery compartment on its back is the key to defeating this enemy quickly.
ST_NPC.DescPleb: The mischievous morons of the toy world. Don't blame them, their IQ is in the single digits.
ST_NPC.DescDrone: The most modern weapon in the enemies arsenal. Mini-drones are fast and deadly. The protective cover is for your protection, not theirs.
ST_NPC.DescChungus: These slimy and wrinkly creatures come from a bubbling swamp in a distant land. Slobologists have studied these creatures and determined that they possess a high level of intelligence. They are transported in crates but all appearances indicate that they have an uncanny ability to escape.
ST_NPC.DescBrobot: They are definitely not your bro. Steer clear of these robots that have been reprogrammed for destruction and attack as a team.
ST_NPC.DescJeep: This four-wheel drive, open bodied off-road vehicle packs serious firepower. It can have an attached machine gun or missile launcher depending on the model.
ST_NPC.DescNinja: With their home world obliterated by malfunctioning Hypercores, they have traveled from the furthest regions of space to rid the universe of the technology keeping all toys alive.

ST_Player.VoiceCommandBuildTurret: We should build a Turret here!
ST_Player.VoiceCommandBuildDefence: We should build some Defences here!
ST_Player.VoiceCommandBuildTraps: We should build some Traps here!

UI.FoundServerUnmatched:
<Text.Green>Failed to find exact matching session.</>

Do you want to join the session '{Session}' on '{Map}' ({Difficulty}), instead?
UI.FoundServerMatchmaking:
<Text.Green>Found matching session '{Session}' on '{Map}' ({Difficulty})</>

Do you want to join this server?
UI.HelpAndSupportTip: <Text.Grey>Scan this QR Code using your</> <Text.Orange>Smart Phone</> <Text.Grey>to visit our Support Forum</>
UI.TipPartyGameJoyCons: <Text.Grey>Single Joy-Con™ per player and supports up to 4 players.</>
UI.TipGameModePvP:
<Text.Orange>Deathmatch</>:
Fight against other players in this Player vs Player mode! Team up and customise the Game Rules for some exciting and fresh gameplay!
UI.FindServerCreateLobby:
<Text.Orange>Failed to find any matching servers.</>

Would you like to create your own Lobby with the current settings?
UI.TipGameModeFR:
<Text.Orange>Free-Roam</>:
Explore the world to learn the best routes and find secret collectibles in your own time or master those jumps!
UI.TipGameModePL:
<Text.Orange>Plague</>:
How long can you survive? Ammo is limited, the infected only need to touch you and it’s over... Can you climb, run and work together to survive the longest?
UI.TipGameModeSA:
<Text.Orange>Spinner Arena</>:
Jump, dash and smash your way to victory upon the airhockey table. Which Spinner will survive this free for all frenzy?
UI.TipGameModeTB:
<Text.Orange>Tank Battle</>:
Tank vs Tank combat in the garden. Can you secure your own corner of the battlefield or will your friends outflank you?
UI.TipGameModeWV:
<Text.Orange>Waves</>:
Protect the HYPERCOREs from enemy toys! Build defences, collect resources and explore the world of HYPERCHARGE. Team up with friends to help complete harder difficulties with more enemies!
UI.DialogBindReplaceKey:
<Text.Orange>{Key}</> is already bound to <Text.Orange>{Action}</>.

Do you want to clear and replace that action?
UI.CreditsSecret: A new secret head has been unlocked!
UI.TipFieldOfViewFP:
Adjust the Field of View of the First-Person Weapon and Arms.

This is a cosmetic change for those who feel the weapon is too large or too small for their screen or current main FOV.
UI.TipGamepadAccelerationRate: Adjust the rate of the acceleration curve while turning the player. Higher values results in faster acceleration.
UI.TipGyroSensitivity: Adjust the sensitivity of the Gyroscope.
UI.TipMouseSensitivity: Adjust the sensitivity of the mouse movement.
UI.TipGamepadSensitivity: Adjust the turn speed of the player.
UI.TipVolumeAnnouncer: Adjust the volume of Max Ammo’s voice.
UI.TipVolumeVoice: Adjust the volume of other players’ voice communication.
UI.TipVolumeGame: Adjust the volume of the game and user interface without affecting the volume of the music.
UI.TipVolumeMusic: Adjust the volume of the music without affecting the volume of the game and user interface.
UI.TipVolumeMaster: Adjust the volume of the overall game and all of the sound effects.
UI.TipVolumeVoiceTransmit: Adjust the volume of your own voice chat when it is transmitted to other players.
UI.TipScaleCameraShake: Adjusts how much the camera shakes. Lowering this can help with motion sickness.
UI.TipScaleWeaponSway: Adjusts how much the weapon will shift around when moving and turning. This cosmetic change is for people who prefer to use the first Person weapon as an anchor point and can help alleviate motion sickness at lower values.
UI.TipScaleUI: Adjusts the overall scale of the user interface in the game and can help with text readability.
UI.TipScaleCrosshair: Adjusts the overall size of the aiming crosshair in the center of the screen.
UI.TipScaleVibration: Adjusts the overall strength of controller vibration.
UI.TipApplySettings: Apply any changes to the display settings to the game. Please wait until you see the conformation dialog to ensure that any settings have applied correctly.
UI.DialogBanPlayer:
Are you sure you want to <Text.Red>BAN</> <Text.Yellow>{Name}</> from your games?

They can only be unbanned by manually editing your ban list in: <Text.Orange>Unboxed/Saved/Config/GameUserSettings.ini</>
UI.DialogDisconnect: Are you sure you want to <Text.Red>Disconnect</> and return to the menu?
UI.DialogEndGame:
Are you sure you want to <Text.Red>End the current game</>?

Any progress or stats from the current round will be lost.
UI.DialogQuit: Are you sure you want to <Text.Red>Quit</> HYPERCHARGE: Unboxed?
UI.DialogResetVideo: Are you sure you want to <Text.Red>Reset video settings</> to default?
UI.DialogResetBinds: Are you sure you want to <Text.Red>Reset your controls</> to default?
UI.DialogReturnToLobby:
Are you sure you want to <Text.Red>Return to the lobby</>?

The current game will end and all progress will be lost.
UI.DialogReturnToMenu:
Are you sure you want to <Text.Red>Return to the main menu</>?

The current game will end and all progress will be lost.
UI.TipGyroSensitivityBoost: Boost the speed of the Gyroscope while aiming.
UI.TipControllerMenu: Change order of your connected controllers.
UI.TipFieldOfView:
Change the Field of View of the camera.

A good value for most people is around 90. Consoles running on a TV should use a lower FOV and people with wider or multi-monitor setups may want to use larger value.
UI.TipSelectLanguage: Change the current language and locale.
UI.TipChangeWeapons: Change the current preview weapon that the player is holding.
UI.TipInputPlatform:
Change the input platform for the game to match your preferred controller input.

Some platforms will adjust the default menu control that are displayed. For example Playstation controls will use Triangle for 'Back' commands.
UI.TipVoiceMenuInput: Change which Gamepad thumbstick controls the input for the voice command radial menu.
UI.TipEditController: Change which controller is being edited with the settings below.
UI.ErrorNetChecksum:
Checksum mismatch.

<Text.Orange>Please check that your game is up to date.</>
UI.TipEffectsQuality:
Choose the quality setting of the Visual Effects in the game. This affects the quality of shaders, reflections, refraction, plastics and particles.

<Text.Perf1>Low*</> Quality FX (Highest Performance)
<Text.Perf2>Medium*</> Quality FX (High Performance)
<Text.Perf3>High</> Quality FX (High Quality)
<Text.Perf4>Max</> Quality FX (Highest Quality)

<Text.Grey>* Reflections and other advanced rendering FX disabled.</>
UI.TipFoliageQuality:
Choose the quality setting of the foliage. This changes the density of grass and other smaller mass-rendered detail objects on levels.

<Text.Perf1>Low</> Most reduced foliage (Highest Performance)
<Text.Perf2>Medium</> Half reduced foliage (High Performance)
<Text.Perf3>High</> Slightly reduced foliage (High Quality)
<Text.Perf4>Max</> Standard foliage count (Highest Quality)
UI.TipPostProcesQuality:
Choose the quality setting of the post processing effects in the game. These are mostly just cosmetic full-screen FX. These affect the overall quality of ambient occlusion, depth of field, lens flares, the tonemapper, and blur.

<Text.Perf1>Low*</> Quality, most FX disabled (Highest performance)
<Text.Perf2>Medium*</> Quality, some FX disabled (High performance)
<Text.Perf3>High</> Quality, no FX disabled (High quality)
<Text.Perf4>Max</> Quality, no FX disabled (Highest quality)

<Text.Grey>* Reflections, background blur and other advanced rendering FX may be disabled.</>
UI.TipShadowQuality:
Choose the quality setting of the shadows in the game.

<Text.Perf1>Low*</> Shadow resolution (0.25x) (Highest performance)
<Text.Perf2>Medium*</> Shadow resolution (0.5x) (High performance)
<Text.Perf3>High</> Shadow resolution (1x) (High quality)
<Text.Perf4>Max</> Shadow resolution (2x) (Highest quality)


<Text.Grey>* Volumetric lighting and other advanced lighting FX disabled.</>
UI.TipTextureQuality:
Choose the quality setting of the textures in the game. This mostly affects the amount of streaming data the engine is allowed to load during runtime.

<Text.Perf1>Low</> Memory (Highest performance)
<Text.Perf2>Medium</> Memory (High performance)
<Text.Perf3>High</> Memory (High quality)
<Text.Perf4>Max</> Memory (Highest quality)
UI.TipViewQuality:
Choose the quality setting of the view distance in the game. Some props in the distance map 'pop' out of existence. This also changes how early high detail models are loaded in.

<Text.Perf1>Halved</> View distance (Highest performance)
<Text.Perf2>Reduced</> View distance (High performance)
<Text.Perf3>Default</> View distance (High quality)
<Text.Perf4>Extended</> View distance (Highest quality)
UI.TipAntiAliasing:
Choose which method is used to help clean up jagged or pixelated edges on the screen.

<Text.Perf1>Off</> = Jagged Edges (Highest Performance)
<Text.Perf2>FXAA</> = Blurry Smooth Edges (High Performance)
<Text.Perf3>TXAA*</> = Smoother Edges (High Quality, Lower Performance)
<Text.Perf4>TXAA-HQ*</> = Smoothest Edges (Highest Quality, Lowest Performance)

<Text.Grey>* May suffer from Ghosting Artifacts.</>
UI.TipRefreshList: Clear the games list and use the current settings to try and find games that you can join.
UI.ErrorOutdatedClient:
Client is outdated.

<Text.Orange>Please check that your game is up to date.</>
UI.TipStatsPage:
Come back here to check your progression in the world of <Text.Yellow>HYPERCHARGE</>.

Complete levels, destroy enemies, find secrets and collectibles, and see what awards you have unlocked!
UI.CreditsSecretAward: Congratulations, you’ve watched to the end of the credits!
UI.TipJoinServer: Connect to the currently selected game.
UI.ErrorConnectionTimeOut: Connection to the server timed out...
UI.TipGameRules: Customise the game rules to spice up your current match! This also allows changing various host options that might be useful.
UI.TipCustomiseMenu: Customise your character and find out how to unlock new skins, heads, buildables, and names!
UI.TipChangeBackground:
Cycle the current background colour.

The chosen background colour will be saved.
UI.TipChangeMusic:
Cycle the music to the next track.

There are 5 tracks.
UI.TipRenderThreadDelay: Disabling the render thread delay can result in removing one frame of latency on inputs, but can result in potential frame drops if your computer is not able to run the game at the maximum frame rate.
UI.DialogSaveApply: Do you want to <Text.Green>Save and apply</> the new Settings?
UI.TipBanPlayer: Do you want to <Text.Red>ban</> <Text.Yellow>{Name}</> from your games?
UI.TipKickPlayer: Do you want to <Text.Red>remove</> <Text.Yellow>{Name}</> from the game?
UI.TipShowFPS:
Do you want to display the frames per second counter on the right hand side of the screen?

This is useful for helping pick what video options are best for your computer.
UI.TipDisplayHealthbars: Do you want to draw health bars over enemies, buildables and players?
UI.TipAmbientOcclusion: Do you want to enable or disable ambient occlusion? This adds shading and depth to the world but can have strange artifacts on edges.
UI.TipRealtimeReflections:
Do you want to enable or disable realtime reflections on any mirror or water surfaces?

This can be performance intensive and negatively impact framerates on maps that use it heavily.

This feature is disabled when playing split screen.
UI.TipDepthOfField:
Do you want to enable or disable the depth of field (distance blur effect) in the levels?

Depth of Field adds a sense of scale to the world, but is not a cheap effect. This can be disabled from the Post Processing Quality setting.
UI.TipVolumetricLighting:
Do you want to enable or disable volumetric lighting?

Volumetic lighting is a performance intensive effect and disabling it can help less powerful computers without impacting the overall visual fidelity of the game.
UI.TipHideRadar: Do you want to hide the Radar weapon attachment and display the on-screen Radar instead?
UI.TipHideHUD:
Do you want to hide the main Heads Up Display?

This can useful for screenshots.
UI.TipFriendsOnly: Do you want to host a game that only allows people on your friends list to join?
UI.TipHostType: Do you want to host an online or local game? Online will allow friends over the internet to play together, local will allow nearby devices to connect and play together.
UI.DialogKeepSettings: Do you want to keep these new settings?
UI.TipGameType: Do you want to play a co-operative or multiplayer game mode?
UI.DialogTutorial:
Do you want to play the tutorial level?

<Text.Grey>This is recommended for players new to the game.</>
UI.TipDisplayDamageFlash: Do you want to see the flash effect when enemies are damaged?
UI.TipUsePushToTalk: Do you want to use a bound input to choose when your voice should be transmitted to other players?
UI.TipUseVoiceChat: Do you want to use voice chat to be able to communicate with other players using a microphone?
UI.TipGamepadAcceleration: Enable if you want to enable acceleration while turning the player.
UI.TipGyroAlways: Enable the Gyroscope to be active at all times instead of only while aiming.
UI.TipGyroAiming: Enable use of the Gyroscope to aid in turning the player.
UI.TipCheatMenu: Enter or enable your <Text.Purple>Cheats</> in this menu.
UI.TipCapturePreview:
Exports a snapshot screenshot (with an Alpha channel) of your character.

Screenshots will be stored in your Unboxed/Unboxed/Screenshots folder.
UI.ErrorJoinFailed: Failed to connect to the server...
UI.ErrorPendingNetGame: Failed to create pending net game.
UI.ErrorNoFriendsPlaying: Failed to find any friends playing HYPERCHARGE
UI.DialogNoServers: Failed to find any matching servers...
UI.ErrorCloudSave: Failed to save files to cloud...
UI.ErrorStartOnlineSession: Failed to start online session. Please check your internet connection.
UI.ErrorTravelFailure: Failed to travel to new level.
UI.TipGenerateRandomCharacter: Generate an entire random character set using all of the currently unlocked heads, skins, materials, names and buildables.
UI.ThankYouDevelopment:
HYPERCHARGE: Unboxed has been in development for over 5 years.








Thank you to all of our fans who supported us in Early Access
UI.TipMoreInformation:
Hold down the more information key to bring up this window. This will can help you understand what a specific menu option does.

This can also be used to find out information about how to unlock a new head, or to find the current stats of a level.
UI.TipScaleNightMode: Increasing this value will tint and darken the screen to help with playing in low-light environments.
UI.TipGamepadInvert: Invert the direction of looking vertically.
UI.TipGyroInvert: Invert the vertical direction of the Gyroscope.
UI.TipMouseInvert: Invert the vertical direction of the mouse movement.
UI.TipMouseSmoothing: Mouse smoothing adjusts the input of the mouse to smooth out the movement when making small increments. This is only recommended when using extremely low DPI mice.
UI.ErrorNoMap:
No level found.

<Text.Orange>Please check that your game is up to date.</>
UI.TipFilterFriendsOnly: Only search for games that are hosted by players on your Friends list.
UI.TipFilterTeamPlay: Only search for games that are playing a Team-based multiplayer mode.
UI.TipFilterMapList: Only search for games that are playing one or more of the currently selected Maps.
UI.TipFilterGameType: Only search for games that are playing this game type. Cooperative or Multiplayer.
UI.TipFilterGameMode: Only search for servers that are playing the currently selected Game Mode.
UI.TipFilterServerLocal: Only search nearby devices for games. Only players hosting a Local Play game will be found. If disabled, online games will be found.
UI.TipFilterServerLAN: Only search the local network for games. If disabled online games will be found.
UI.TipChangeKeyBinds: Open a menu that allows customising key inputs. If not using the mouse and keyboard input platform then this will open the gamepad layout selector.
UI.TipChangeGamepayLayout: Open a menu to select different button layouts for your controller.
UI.TipGyroLockMode: Optionally use specific direction of movement from the Gyroscope by locking veritcal or horizontal movement.
UI.ErrorPackageMissing:
Package is missing.

<Text.Orange>Please check that your game is up to date.</>
UI.ErrorPackageVersion:
Package version mismatch.

<Text.Orange>Please check that your game is up to date.</>
UI.DialogGuestAccountCopy:
Please note that this player is a <Text.Orange>Guest</> and will <Text.Red>NOT</> be able to Load or Save any of their progression.

Would you like this player to start with the unlockables from the primary user account?
UI.DialogBindPressKey: Press a key to bind to <Text.Cyan>{Action}</>
UI.TipFindGame: Search for a server that matches the current filter settings. If a server cannot be found, your will be prompted to start an online lobby for other players to join.
UI.SelectNameElement: Select a new Name Element from the list above.
UI.TipSplitScreen3: Select how the screen is split when playing with 3 players.
UI.TipSplitScreen2: Select how the screen is split when playing with only 2 players.
UI.TipFrameRateLimit:
Select the limit that you would like to apply to the frame rate in the game.

This can be used to lower the FPS on less powerful computers, or to lift the usual limits when using a high refresh rate monitor.
UI.TipMaxPlayers: Select the maximum number of players allowed in this match.
UI.TipGameMode: Select the overall game mode that defines the rules of the game. Different game modes are limited to different game types.
UI.TipResolution:
Select the resolution of the display window.

<Text.Orange>This should match the resolution of your desktop.</>
UI.TipAnisotropicQuality:
Select the strength of the texture filtering used when rendering textures on an angle. This is easiest to see when looking at a flat surface in the distance.

<Text.Grey>Off</> = Blurry (Maximum Performance)
<Text.Perf1>2x</> = Slightly Sharper (Highest Performance)
<Text.Perf2>4x</> = Sharper (Good Quality, Good Performance)
<Text.Perf3>8x</> = Even Sharper (High Quality, Lower Performance)
<Text.Perf4>16x</> = Sharpest (Highest Quality, Lowest Performance)
UI.ErrorOutdatedServer:
Server is outdated.

<Text.Orange>Please try joining a server that matches your version.</>
UI.TipVerticalSync:
Set enabled to help remove the effects of screen tearing by locking the frame rate. Screen tearing can occur when the game runs at rate that doesn't match your monitor.

Enabling V-Sync may result in input latency.

V-Sync is not needed if you have a G-Sync monitor. 

Some graphics drivers allow overriding the V-Sync option in some games if the internal solution is too aggressive.
UI.TipDisplayGamma:
Set the Gamma of the current Display.

Useful for brightening the screen during daytime, or to help with overall brightness when using a HDR display.
UI.TipResolutionScale:
Set the resolution scale of the internal renderer.

<Text.Orange>This is preferable to changing the resolution if you wish to gain performance.</>
UI.TipScreenMode:
Set the screen mode of the display window.

Windowed = Run in a window
Fullscreen = Run in exclusive fullscreen
Fullscreen Borderless = Run in a fullscreen window
UI.TipStartGameParty: Start a <Text.Orange>Local multiplayer</> Party Game with friends using the currently selected settings.
UI.TipStartGame: Start a game with the currently selected settings.
UI.TipStartGameSingleplayer: Start a singleplayer game with the currently selected settings.
UI.TipStartGameSplitscreen: Start a split-screen game with the currently selected settings.
UI.ThankYouForPlaying: Aye Matey, thanks for playing the game laddie!
UI.TipScaleHUD:
The scale of the heads up display.

This will help increase or decrease the size of the in-game HUD to better suit the distance your are from the screen or for general readability.
UI.TipOffsetGamepad: This can be used to offset the first gamepad so that it controls player 2, leaving olayer 1 to use mouse and keyboard.
UI.DemoNoFeature: This feature is <Text.Red>NOT</> available in the <Text.Cyan>Demo</> version of the game.
UI.TipToggleLighting: Toggle lighting on the character preview to better see emissive details.
UI.TipGenerateName: Try your luck and generate a random name out of your unlocked name combinations!
UI.TipMatchmaking: Use online matchmaking to automatically set you up in an online match. If a matching game cannot be found a new one will be created with your current settings.
UI.TipSplitScreenQuality:
Use this to offset and lower the current video settings while playing in split screen.

Split screen is very demanding, and this feature will allow you to lower the video settings without affecting your current saved settings.
UI.TipFindServers: View a list of active servers, filter the list, and then select a game to join.
UI.TipFindMatchmaking: View and edit settings for the matchmaking system to find an online match automatically.
UI.TipMapSelection: View and edit the current list of maps. This will also display your current level progress and awards if you’re playing the <Text.Orange>Co-operative</> game mode.
UI.TipMotionBlur: We try not to use this effect too much as we don't like it being applied excessively but disabling it entirely can gain some extra performance.
UI.TipToggleAiming: When enabled pressing the aim button will toggle aiming instead of having to hold down the aim key.
UI.TipToggleSprint: When enabled pressing the sprint button will toggle sprinting of the player instead of having the hold down the sprint key.
UI.TipCreditsMenu:
Who are the people behind the game?

<Text.Grey>There may also be a secret hidden somewhere in the credits!</>
